title: How Babies Babble with Their Hands
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on How Babies Babble with Their Hands.

hook.text: Hearing babies babble sounds. Deaf babies of signing parents babble with their hands.

buildup.text: Researchers filmed deaf infants and found they make repetitive hand movements that mirror vocal babbling.

discovery.text: Hand babbling follows the same developmental timeline as vocal babbling â€” around 7 to 10 months.

twist.text: This proves babbling isn't about sound â€” it's about the brain practicing language, whatever the modality.

climax.text: The language instinct is so powerful that babies will practice it through whatever channel is available.

punchline.text: Babies don't babble because they can hear. They babble because they're human.

quiz.question: What do deaf babies of signing parents do?
options: They babble with their hands at the same age hearing babies babble vocally
They babble vocally like hearing babies
